author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
A day after Jawaharlal Nehru University Student’s Union president Kanhaiya Kumar was released from jail and addressed students on the JNU campus, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar endorsed his words on Friday and said “the country needs azadi from intolerance, poverty and capitalism.”

Mr. Kumar said “dissatisfaction” in the country was growing and to suppress it, the BJP had spread a new shagufa (trick) of “patriotism” and it had been established with what Mr. Kanhaiya Kumar had said.

“Kanhaiya Kumar’s speech was very effective … whatever he has said was true and right … the country needs freedom from intolerance, poverty and capitalism … these words prove that our new generation has a lot of potential and if such students and youth will come forward, the roots of democracy will become more strengthened,” Mr. Nitish Kumar told journalists at the Patna airport after returning from Nepal.
title: BJP using patriotism as trick: Nitish
